intro: Pentacrypta atropurpurea, commonly known as the purplestem false nettle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems that turn reddish-purple in color, and its small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The plant is often found in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and wetlands.
